title: Sans family
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905032308im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/magnet_5470.jpg)

Does anyone have the name of this sans serif family?

 [‹ Budget car rental](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905032308/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47873 "Go to previous forum topic") [Costa foundation logo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905032308/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47870 "Go to next forum topic")
author: svenni

comments.content:
FF Fago, condensed and normal in different weights?  
//much to late
Are you still having difficulty visiting FontShop.com, Jan?
No. I’m running an old OS and can’t access fancy flash sites right now.
There is no Flash on FontShop.com.
No? Well, anyways. Can’t access the site right now.
That’s what confuses me. I want to make sure there’s nothing wrong on our end.

Don’t worry, Stephen. I’m running an oooooold OS and an oooooold browser.  
Site works fine.

You’re not talking about [fontshop. **de**](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905032308/http:/www.fontshop.de/), Jan?  
That site heavily relies on Flash and badly needs an overhaul.

Nope, Florian. Actually, I can access that site with this old Mozilla 1.3.1.  
And yes. It sucks.

Now I’m browsing up to date. See:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905032308im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/fine_4836.jpg)
Woohoo! Welcome to the world of tomorrow!

Well, this is not quite the world of tomorrow (MacOSX 10.3.9, Firefox 2.0.0.16).

I’m a lo-fi kinda guy.
Jan 2.0! Pretty soon that ’fi’ will show the standard ligature by default. Stay tuned.
